Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 501 deluxe chambre. The door opened directly onto the bedroom so the room felt smaller than it actually was. There was enough room to walk around and store our luggage so we were happy. It's been recently renovated, so it felt clean. The room itself isn't new, so you can tell it was an old style hotel with a makeover. For example, the bar fridage and cabinetry isn't overly expensive looking / upmarket. It's been renovated but not completely replaced if you know what I mean. There are big glass mirrors on the wardrobe doors which make the room feel bigger too. The bathroom was modern, but it had a bath/shower which I'm not a huge fan of. But it was clean and new. The shower head had great pressure for washing my hair. The queen sized bed was quite hard, but comfortable. They provided a europe pillow and single feather pillow - and a comfy doona. There was a flat screen TV above the coffee facilities/bar fridge (but no sleepmtimer function) and they had a good range of TV channels. The minibar was drinks and free. water oj, coke. (no food, or milk at all for coffee) The room we were in looked in to a central courtyard / void, so no views over Paris, but there were flowers in the window sills which was nice. The location was good and I'd stay there again, but make sure you get a deal on expedia or similar, as the rack rate is insane. You should be able to get a good discount most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: DennisBa
Reviews.Content: No matter how hard i think i cant think of anything negative to say about Grand Hotel saint-Michel. Our stay in the hotel was great, very friendly staff, nicely decorated rooms for a decent price. The location is perfect, especially if you like Parc du Luxembourg because it's literally around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Paris if you have Non standard European tastes”
Reviews.Author: livingabroaduk
Reviews.Content: They offered a good size room (for Paris standards) In addition to the bed there was room for our suitcases and you could even still walk around. Bed was actually comfortable. Which for us I think was a first for Europe. Usually they are very hard or you have springs poking you. This was neither, just like home. Location was excellent as its right next to the RER line so you have direct metro access to the airport or the rest of the city. Close walking distance to lots of food options. Our favorite was Breakfast In America on 17, rue des Ecoles (not far from Notre-Dame) American type breakfast with a French flair. Everything was clean and the hotel provided pretty much everything you would need. Mini-bar was free and included (in included juice, water, and some soda) Staff was friendly and spoke English well. They were helpfull with answering questions and giving directions. Breakfast is or wasn't included in our rate. To add it was 15 euros/person. I don't know how good it was but for 30 euros you can eat at a lot of other great places for less. We got a great deal on venere [----] and couldn't be happer with our trip. I think the only gripes we might have was the drain in the tub was slow. It was such a great stay so there really isn't anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “An affordable Grand hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Batta83
Reviews.Content: Finally, finally, an affordable yet stylish hotel in the heart of the Saint Germain de Prë district. Rooms are modern and very well decorated, staff is frienly and it"s not the usual cut throatbusiness in Parisian hotels. The minibar (soft drinks) and free WiFi were included in the room rate. Breakfast is served in a very cosy room in the cellar. Compared to what you usually get in Paris a great breakfast with freshly squeezed orange juice and delightful offerings. This place is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “All around awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Pescabilia
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Grand Hotel St. Michel. The service is great, the rooms are clean and modern, and the price is value for money. My biggest recommendation is to make sure to take advantage of the breakfast! For the price, the breakfast is amazing. If I ate breakfast in the hotel, I did not need to eat again until dinner. This hotel has quickly become one of my favorite hotels in the world. It is a total package hotel; location, price, cleanliness, service. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: GodisGoood
Reviews.Content: great location. located near a tube stop. quiet clean beautiful hotel. would stay here again. there are lots of places to eat. close to popular sites. big rooms the safe was so helpful. good deal we booked through hotels.com and paid $164 per night. comfy bed and very modern

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great location, good internet price”
Reviews.Author: Blackbird08
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent, very modern and clean. The location was excellent, only a short walk to the Metro, left bank etc. The internet price (direct with the hotel) at €159 was much better than the advertised €320. Did not bother to have breakfast here as loads of local cafes for a much cheaper croissant and cup of coffee. Would definately recommend this and glady stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel But Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Becky0032
Reviews.Content: Warm welcome at the hotel and we were upgraded to a deluxe room, still fairly small, but beautifully decorated and with lovely bathroom. However we found the hotel services a bit limited - there was no hotel guide in the room explaining hotel facilities (phone, internet connetion, breakfast etc) which was a shame, and there were no tea/coffee facilities (nor complementary water) in the room. Other than that, we really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very helpful, even let me go behind their desk to check-in online for my flight home! Also, now with the Euro being what it is, we paid approx £200 per night, which, given the limited in-room facilities and no breakfast included, was a bit pricey really.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, very stylish decor in this comfortable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: nia4334
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in an ideal location, close to bus and train route. Many restaurants and cafes in close proximity. Open-top tour bus stops very close to hotel , which was extremely convenient. Bus number 21 from the end of the road will get you directly to Galleries Lafayette for under 2 euros! Reception staff were welcoming - however I felt that they could have shared information about the hotel, local transport routes and surrounding area. On arrival we were simply given the key to our room, no mention whatsoever of the hotel facilities, Jardin de Luxembourg or the Pantheon which are only a few minutes walk from the hotel. Place de la Sorbonne was a lovely place to spend an evening. My tip for future visits: Stay at this hotel and if we fly easyjet to Paris again I would certainly opt for the minibus transfer from CDG rather than take the train. It's about 5 euros more expensive than the train ticket but well worth it ,as the station is a fair walk from terminal 2B. The minibus transfer is door to door. We had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: yudesi
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in St. Michel area in this hotel and can't say much about the wonderful staff. Especially the lady at the reception Lena has been superb in facilitating guests to restaurants and other venues. Overall i had a wonderful stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable stay I would be happy to repeat.”
Reviews.Author: Alex81261
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful with all our inquiries. They provided us with guidance to an excellent restaurant which just happened to be a little further up the street. Breakfast was provided in the room at no extra cost. The room was kept clean and tidy to a very high standard. We were never disturbed by the staff even though we were late going out sometimes. The inner courtyard is no view however it was quiet. There is a preliminary school nearby and the sound of this can be heard from time to time. A health/fitness area is in the process of being constructed.

Reviews.Title: “Updated and comfortable hotel in the best area if you are on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Kozzy50
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel after searching though almost 50 other hotels in Paris. If you are on vacation and have not been to Paris before, this area is excellent to stay in. Saint Germain is close enough to all the tourist sites while still being among locals. This hotel was completely renovated and opened in 2009. We got a great deal through their website. Located on a great side street and about 5 min walk to metro and a ton on restaurants and shopping, this small out of the way boutique hotel made us feel right at home in Paris. Service was excellent from each person at the front desk. We had reservations for two separate rooms. Two days in a classic least expensive room, and two days in the suite. The rooms are small but honestly, no matter where you go in Paris, the room will be small unless you are at a major hotel chain. Just be prepared for that. These buildings are hundreds of years old. But the room itself. Modern, comfortable and the beds are awesome. Another hard to come by item in Paris. A good bed and pillow. These were great. We lucked out and got the smallest, cheapest room but on the 5th floor with a balcony. Some don't have this. I'd request it on the 5th floor at checkin. We then transfered to the suite. Still small for a suite but an exceptional room at that. Separate living room, bathroom with jacuzzi, separate toilet, and separate bedroom. On the 5th floor with wrap around balcony because it's a corner suite. Wow. If you can upgrade, I'd recommend it. One last thing to mention. Free WiFi and each room has fridge with free drinks inside. We had waters, coke, juices, ect. No alcohol. How great is that. Other hotels charge an arm and a leg for these. When we're back in Paris, I'll be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kean2travel
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a prime location in the heart of Paris. The rooms were a little on the small size but you soon get use to that. The staff are very friendly. the only downside would be the price, breakfast wasn't included.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: castewil
Reviews.Content: recently renewed with taste , this little hotel has all you may wish for in a hotel: central location (walking distance to Notre Dame, Luxembourg gardens, Pantheon, St Michel restaurant area etc), friendly staff, nice breakfast buffet in an antique vaulted cellar. And it's quiet (a rare thing in Paris). Okay the rooms are not huge but all you can wish for is there, wrapped up in a modern design. Bed is great. What more can I say? (fitness stuff is there but workout room is being finished; march 13th 09). Public parking (25EUR/night) round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern rooms in great area”
Reviews.Author: GasparK
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very modern which is not usual in Paris as all hotels have decoration from the 1900's. They are very small though and you can hardly find a space to leave your luggage. The bathroom is perfect and modern. The staff are very polite and helpfull (especially the men). We didnt have breakfast so i cannot commend on that. I think it is too expensive 15Euro per person. You can have coffee from Starbucks which is 3 minutes walking from the hotel and have a nice crepe with chocolate on Boulevard Saint Michel.The beds are probably the best beds i have ever slept on vacation. The rooms are very quiet and there is also wireless internet (no charge). The Luxembourg station is 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel and has direct trains to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “great price (hope it lasts!)”
Reviews.Author: blissapp
Reviews.Content: The hotel overlooks the sorbonne uni. in a very good bit of paris for restaurants and a 5 minute walk from Notre Dame. Also a 5 minute walk to the nearest Metro/RER station, so the whole of paris is available. Travelling into Beauvais, I got the coach and then a taxi to the hotel which only cost 5 euros, not too bad at all. Breakfast was a bit overpriced and there is still a little ongoing work in the basement where the dining room is, but overall a very pleasant experience and fantastic staff were very helpful. Rate was their "Internet Special" - well worth the money - book from their own website for the best rate. Don't think their published tariff will really stand up to other hotels though, it's a small hotel with no facilities above the breakfasts... Maybe normal in paris though. Nice touches like free wifi (a must these days) and a free minibar (free as in price and free as in alcohol-free, it was soft drinks only). Very pretty decorations in the room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service at a great discount”
Reviews.Author: frenchtrotter2
Reviews.Content: excellent service and very friendly staff - the hotel gave amazing discount for their relaunch (after extensive refurbishment)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mckean2
Reviews.Content: After trawling through lots of Paris hotels i decided to go with this one. What a fantastic decision, it has a great location near Luxembourg metro (which you can access on the direct line from the airport) there is a great cafe opposite the Jardin du Luxembourg, and the Jardin du Luxembourg itself is beautiful. Its a 10 mins walk to Note Dame and there are lots of restaurants within a 10/15mins walk away. The rooms were lovely, perfectly clean, with a great bathroom with a double shower, a free minibar with soft drinks which were topped up each day. Would recommend to family and friends. Am planning my trip back to Paris in the summer and will definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: Haz86
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. Modern, lovely decor, very friendly staff, spotless rooms, excellent location....a fantastic hotel!! Located on a quiet side street, you are no more than 1 minute away from the shops, restaurants and bars of St Michel Boulevard without any of the noise that staying on the main street brings. The room was large for Paris, with a fantastic bed, lovely decor and brand new bathroom. The reception area is beautiful and the lady on repception spoke excellent english and was very welcoming. On top of this, notre dame, the beautiful banks of the seine and subway stops are no more than 5 mins walk down the road. In all a wonderful hotel hard to find any faults with it at all!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: sulimans
Reviews.Content: An excellent “boutique” hotel in the heart of Paris. The rooms are so elegantly furnished with modern touch and updated bathrooms. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly. The hotel has a free wireless high-speed internet service and a complementary mini bar stuffed with soft drinks, ojs and mineral water. The breakfast buffet costs 15 Euros but definitely worth it. This hotel is the best in Paris for its price, its quality and its location. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Saint-Michel”
Reviews.Author: pjhaak612
Reviews.Content: Our family with teenage kids stayed 4 nights just after Christmas 2008. Great location within walking distance to the Notre Dame. Rooms smallish, but very clean, the front desk helpful and friendly. Bathrooms amazing. Free juices and bottled waters in the fridge. We definitely hope to be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Hotel Sanint-Michel”
Reviews.Author: jbenajes
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel, in a quite street. Furniture and decoration is new and modern style, and of good quality. The girl at the reception desk was extremely nice and helpful, as was the staff during breakfast. The standard room is not very large, but everything was new and modern. Heating did not work at some moment, but it was fixed in ten minutes after complaining. There were no information leaflets at all in the room, to the extreme that at a certain moment we did not know how to contact the reception desk by the internal phone. Breakfast buffet (15 euro) is not cheap, but the ratio price/quality is not bad, for Paris . In all, at the price we paid for the room (less than half the indicated list price), the hotel is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Sorbonne”
Reviews.Author: kauris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is recently refurbished and very modern. In the room everything was new, nice and modern. Room was small but so they are in Paris, so this was not a problem. My room was very cold. Every time I entered the room I thought maybe a window was open but wasn't. Breakfast would have been ok but the problem was that if you weren't there quite early, there wasn't much left. And this was the same every day. Even bread ran out. Not to speak of cheese and cold cuts. The hotel is very close to Sorbonne, all in all a nice area. Despite the recent refurbishment, windows weren't double to prevent sounds from the street. As the area is lively and there a restaurant with a terrace you may hear some noise very late.

Reviews.Title: “fab boutique hotel, small but perfectly formed rooms!”
Reviews.Author: kathybarlow
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed for 3 nights, we had a room on the 5th floor, which was lovely, mirrored wardrobes, comfy bed, shame about the pillows, they were too hard. The bathroom was lovely, compact but everything you could need and a shower that was quite powerful. The room was clean and the soap/towels changed every day. The location is excellent; Notre Dame is only a 10 minute walk and all the bars/restaurants also within walking distance. The hotel has only just been renovated and was having a spa installed in the next building which we were told would be ready early next year, when we return to Paris we will definitely be stopping there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hjamus
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris several times and always been disappointed with accommodation, but the St Michel was beautifully designed with extremely helpful staff. The rooms are small (as usual for Paris) but really well decorated with a modern bathroom and power shower. Only complaint is the noise levels at night from outside (there is a pub on the same street) but I would definitely stay again. Location wise it is walking distance to St Germain des Pres, and The Leovre/ Notre Dam/ Musee D'Orsay. Only 15 mins in a taxi from Gare du Nord for the eurostar. Would recommmend!

Reviews.Title: “almost ready”
Reviews.Author: aubonheur
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself has just been renovated, the room i stayed in was ultra-modern and beautiful--lots of glass--with a small balcony. However, perhaps because everything is new, it isn't all working properly yet--a fuse blew at one point, and the bathtub (bubble-jets!) didn't always work. The staff was unfailingly friendly and obliging (spoke english as well), but also seemed to be inexperienced, and not always to know what was going on. Both these problems, I think, will go away as the technical kinks are worked out and the staff is seasoned a bit. the location of the hotel is perfect. arriving in CDG, the RER lets you out a block from the hotel. the neighborhood is buzzing with students and activity during the day, but since the hotel faces away from the main streets, it is relatively peaceful at night. walking distance to many major tourist destinations, and plenty of dining in the vicinity off of rue mont-st-genevieve, descartes, and up to mouffetard. all in all, highly recommended at a base-camp for paris. once the technical problems are worked out, five of five.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Rami-Archi
Reviews.Content: I offered my fiancee a night there for her birthday, and we were very pleased by the room, we stayed in the suite The room is slightly small for a suite, but very well divided, the bathroom is surrounded by glass that give on the living room as well as the bedroom which is fun, you can also, if you don't mind, open the curtains and look at the roofs of Paris from your bathtub We also took the breakfast the next morning, it's 15 euros head, the choice is fine, but if you're passing by Paris on holiday, you can walk around, the hotel being between Luxembourg and Saint Michel, and find nice/cheaper spots for breakfast In a nutshell, for it's 3 stars, the hotel offers an above average suite, with a very nice view on Paris as well as a great location Single problem I had, one of the staff opened the room while I was changing, probably to show the Suite to other clients

Reviews.Title: “I would return”
Reviews.Author: stevenullman
Reviews.Content: The room was small (as are most rooms in Paris) but quite nice. The location is wonderful; we walked everywhere we went, including the Louvre and other Right Bank locations. The hotel staff are wonderful and very helpful. I would return to the Grand Hotel Saint-Michel without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: coyd
Reviews.Content: Pleasant small boutique style hotel in a handy location for Latin Quarter, Notre Dame and St Germain area. NB; I don't think the website is up to date as the hotel is very contemporary in style,no longer having period furnishings and has no lounges or bar as stated on the hotel website. We stayed for 3 nights and booked a superior double room. Rooms small but with contemporary furnishings. Very clean. Try to avoid room 604...which is on top floor. Rather cramped and only has a half size wardrobe due to the alcove, and shock horror, no bathroom mirror other than a shaving mirror which is magnified! This wouldn't be too bad if there was another accessible mirror in the bedroom...but there isn't! Not good for us ladies. We slept for 1 night in the room and then mentioned the probs to reception the next morning...they immediately offered us an alternative room and we moved in within 15 minutes...excellent service! Reception staff extremely helpful with this and also with general info about Paris. Speak good English. We didn't have breakfast, so cannot comment other than it was 15 Euros each. Both rooms we stayed in had flat screen TV, DVD and were very nicely furnished. Bathrooms lovely...great trendy sinks and lovely power showers. Our second room had a seperate toilet, which is always welcome. There is no bar at this hotel and no hotel info booklet in the room, so am unsure whether they have room service. This wasn't a huge prob as there are so many bars, cafes close by. Minibar...but only soft drinks. Hotel within 10 mins walk of RER-Luxembourg station and close to shops etc. Also about 10 mins walk to river! Water bus is a good way to see Paris...about 11 Euros and can jump on and off at various points of interest. Open top bus more expensive. Quiet location...not woken by street noise.Generally speaking was a nice hotel, moderately priced and we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absoulutly wonderfull!!!”
Reviews.Author: Z1985
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and spacious rooms, friendly staff, nicely decorated, great view from the balcony. I just can't complain about anything! i\It was the best vacation I've ever had and I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Anita1967
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, about a 10 minute walk from the RER station and the same distance to the Latin Quarter which was great for restaurants in the evening. Hotel was very average, nothing special but wasn't expecting much of a Paris 3 star. Bathroom tiny, with paint peeling off door and the bath/shower had definitely seen better days, although shower was actually quite powerful. No problems re heating issues as in previous reviews. We were on the 3rd floor and if you leant out your window you could see the top of the Pantheon! Ok for a short stay but have stayed in a better 2 star in Lisbon in October. Can't comment on breakfast as we went to nearby cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fair room”
Reviews.Author: alagnak
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights over Thanksgiving. I'd been in Paris before, and have always stayed in the 5th. This was the first time for my wife in the city, and wanted to show her the neighborhood I've 'adopted' near the Sorbonne, and you can't get much closer than this. The hotel was fine in nearly all respects. THe location is fantastic, overlooking the Sorbonne and a block from the Pantheon. A block and a half from the Luxembourg RER stop, so convenient from the airport, and 3 blocks to the Cluny Metro. It's a short walk to the Rue de Baci marketplace, a lot of nice small restaurants, Notre Dame, and maybe 10 minutes walk to the Pont Neuf and then the Louvre. The rooms are pretty standard central Paris. Smallish (I've been in smaller roomks in this neighborhood, but expected a little more room in a 3-star), no-frills, clean. The bathroom is quite large and nice by 5th standards, and likely the reason it warrants the extra star. Breakfast was included in our rate and we did it twice (although both times, we got our coffee elsewhere). I'd highly recommend NOT including breakfast (average-at-best food, terrible coffee) and heading around the corner (literally) to one of the cafes on Place de la Sorbonne for a cafe' and baguette. The staff were friendly and helpful and we really were never unsatisfied, just merely 'satisfied'. If you can, try and get a 5th floor room with a balcony. In short, nothing was actually bad, and, outside of the location, nothing was 'great', but I think you can get better value for your money in this area. Spend a little less for a similar location, similar room and a smaller bathroom, or a little more for a larger/newer room. In the end, Paris, and the 5th/6th in particular, have so much to offer, it's hard to fixate on the room very much.
